avalancheActivity.comment: The new snow and wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant. Wind slabs are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. They are covered with new snow and are difficult to recognise. In particular on very steep shady slopes the avalanches can be released in the various wind slab layers and reach large size.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In particular in the regions of the north exposed to the foehn wind wind slabs formed.

snowpackStructure.comment: 10 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen. The wind was strong. The soft wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack. The new snow and wind slabs are lying on a crust in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2400 m. Snow depths vary greatly at intermediate and high altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind.

avalancheActivity.comment: The more recent wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads, in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2700 m. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in gullies and bowls and in the vicinity of peaks. In some places wind slabs are lying on an icy crust. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs require caution, especially along the border with France.

snowpackStructure.comment: Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to gradual consolidation of the snowpack. Below approximately 2200 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. Above approximately 2500 m snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to significant settling of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes.

avalancheActivity.comment: The storm force wind has transported the fresh and old snow significantly. The fresh and older wind slabs represent the main danger. In particular on steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain medium-sized slab avalanches are possible. Avalanches can be released, even by small loads in isolated cases. Between approximately 2400 and 3000 m the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs are to be evaluated with care and prudence.

snowpackStructure.comment: As a consequence of the wind, the snow drift accumulations have increased in size. Snow depths vary greatly at high altitude, depending on the infuence of the wind. Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to consolidation of the snowpack at low and intermediate altitudes. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: Even in moderately steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: From a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: In all altitude zones hardly any snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: Even in moderately steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: From a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: In particular at low and intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying. Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in all aspects.
